dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form
Class SWTTreeColumnDescription

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.SWTColumnDescription
      dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.SWTTreeColumnDescription

public class SWTTreeColumnDescription
extends SWTColumnDescription

A TreeTable Column Description defines the type, width, name, mementoId, tooltip, defaultvalue of a table column and the default icons for the different hierarchies of this tree column. Example: 

 SWTColumnDescription[] descs = new SWTColumnDescription[5];
 descs[0] = new SWTTreeColumnDescription(
     "Float",
     "MEMENTO1",
     WidgetFactory.TextFormat.FLOAT,
     100,
     "1.1",
     new String[]{"myIcon.png"} );
 descs[1] = new SWTColumnDescription( "Integer", "MEMENTO2", WidgetFactory.TextFormat.INTEGER, 100, "2" );
 descs[2] = new SWTColumnDescription( "String", "MEMENTO3", WidgetFactory.TextFormat.TEXT, 100, "abc" );
 descs[3] = new SWTColumnDescription( "Boolean", "MEMENTO4", WidgetFactory.TextFormat.BOOLEAN, 100, "false" );
 descs[4] = new SWTColumnDescription( "Combo", "MEMENTO5", 100, new String[]{"ONE", "TWO", "THREE"}, "ONE" );
 
 factory.createTreeTable( parentComposite,
                          IConstants.WIDGET_ID_TABLE,
                          IConstants.MEMENTO_KEY_TABLE,
                          "My Table",
                          10,
                          descs,
                          WidgetFactory.TABLE_ACTION_ALL );

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

Since:
2009.a

SWTTreeColumnDescription

public SWTTreeColumnDescription(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String mementoId,
                                WidgetFactory.TextFormat format,
                                java.lang.String defaultValue)
Describes a SWTTreeTable column.

Parameters:
name - the name of the column
mementoId - the mementoId
format - the TextFormat
defaultValue - the defaultValue for this column, if none should be set enter null
Since:
2009.a

SWTTreeColumnDescription

public SWTTreeColumnDescription(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String mementoId,
                                WidgetFactory.TextFormat format,
                                java.lang.String defaultValue,
                                java.lang.String[] iconPaths,
                                boolean[] editableRows,
                                boolean[] structuralEditableRows)
Describes a SWTTreeTable column representing the first column of a SWTTreeTable with icons for different tree levels.

Parameters:
name - the name of the column
mementoId - the mementoId
format - the TextFormat
defaultValue - the defaultValue for this column, if none should be set enter null
iconPaths - an array of relative path for the icons of the tree levels
editableRows - an array of boolean ordered by row level where each boolean is set to true if the correspnoding row level should be editable. null if all levels should be editable
structuralEditableRows - an array of boolean ordered by row level where each boolean is set to true if the correspnoding row level should be structural editable(add, remove item). null if all levels should be structural editable
Since:
2009.a

editableRows - an array of boolean ordered by row level where each boolean is set to true if the correspnoding row level should be editable. null if all levels should be editable
structuralEditableRows - an array of boolean ordered by row level where each boolean is set to true if the corresponding row level should be structural editable(add, remove item). null if all levels should be structural editable

mementoId - the mementoId
format - the TextFormat
width - the width of the column
defaultValue - the defaultValue for this column, if none should be set enter null
numberFormat - The format in which to show numbers (only works for integer entries)
separators - true to show separators in numbers

SWTTreeColumnDescription

public SWTTreeColumnDescription(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String mementoId,
                                WidgetFactory.TextFormat format,
                                int width,
                                java.lang.String[] range,
                                java.lang.String defaultValue,
                                ValueConverter.NumberFormat numberFormat,
                                boolean separators,
                                java.lang.String[] iconPaths,
                                boolean[] editableRows,
                                boolean[] structuralEditableRows)
Describes a SWTTreeTable column representing the first column of a SWTTreeTable with icons for different tree levels.

Parameters:
name - the name of the column
mementoId - the mementoId
format - the TextFormat
width - the width of the column
range - valid enum values
defaultValue - the defaultValue for this column, if none should be set enter null
numberFormat - The format in which to show numbers (only works for integer entries)
separators - true to show separators in numbers
iconPaths - an array of relative path for the icons of the tree levels
editableRows - an array of boolean ordered by row level where each boolean is set to true if the corresponding row level should be editable. null if all levels should be editable
structuralEditableRows - an array of boolean ordered by row level where each boolean is set to true if the correspnoding row level should be structural editable(add, remove item). null if all levels should be structural editable
Since:
2009.a

SWTTreeColumnDescription

public SWTTreeColumnDescription(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String mementoId,
                                WidgetFactory.TextFormat format,
                                int width,
                                java.lang.String[] range,
                                java.lang.String defaultValue,
                                ValueConverter.NumberFormat numberFormat,
                                boolean separators,
                                java.lang.String[] iconPaths,
                                boolean[] editableRows,
                                boolean editable,
                                boolean[] structuralEditableRows)
Describes a SWTTreeTable column representing the first column of a SWTTreeTable with icons for different tree levels.

Parameters:
name - the name of the column
mementoId - the mementoId
format - the TextFormat
width - the width of the column
range - valid enum values
defaultValue - the defaultValue for this column, if none should be set enter null
numberFormat - The format in which to show numbers (only works for integer entries)
separators - true to show separators in numbers
iconPaths - an array of relative path for the icons of the tree levels
editableRows - an array of boolean ordered by row level where each boolean is set to true if the corresponding row level should be editable. null if all levels should be editable
editable - false to make this column read-only for the user
structuralEditableRows - an array of boolean ordered by row level where each boolean is set to true if the corresponding row level should be structural editable(add, remove item). null if all levels should be structural editable
Since:
2009.a
Method Detail

getIconPaths

public java.lang.String[] getIconPaths()
Returns the list of relative path to the icons for the different levels of the tree.

Returns:
array of icon paths
Since:
2009.a

getEditableRows

public boolean[] getEditableRows()
Returns for each row level if it is editable or not.

If nothing is specified for a level then the row level is editable by default

Returns:
an array of boolean ordered by row level where each boolean is set to true if the correspnoding row level should be editable. null if all levels should be editable
Since:
2009.a

getStructuralEditableRows

public boolean[] getStructuralEditableRows()
Returns for each row level if it is structural editable or not. This means if it is allowed to add or remove items to/from this level or not.

If nothing is specified for a level then the row level is editable by default

Returns:
an array of boolean ordered by row level where each boolean is set to true if the correspnoding row level should be structural editable. null if all levels should be structural editable
Since:
2009.a
